Q: Underneath my genital area on the upper inner thigh I have a patch of dry white-ish skin on each side.....Is this just from chafing? (I am overweight). Or is this some sort of fungal infection? (it is only on the upper inner thigh-not the genital area)
A: Hello. Thanks for writing to us at Chat Doctor Most likely it is a fungal infection. Fungal infection are common at sites of body folds like upper inner thighs, maxilla, submammary folds etc. Chaffing/scaling is a feature of fungal infections. Itching is usually a feature too, but it is subjective in individuals. Being overweight adds to the possibility of fungal infection. If I was the treating doctor I would have asked you to use a topical antifungal cream. Clotrimazole 1% cream is available OTC and you may use this for 4-6 weeks. Oral antifungals e.g. fluconazole are more effective in controlling the symptoms and are usually prescribed once a week for 4-6 weeks. However, oral antifungals are prescription Chat Doctor. An OTC oral antihistamine e.g. cetirizine 10 mg once daily would provide you symptomatic relief from itching.
